title: How Donald Trump endangered US national security
description: The indictment against the former US president provides details on the careless storage of the files taken from the White House to the Mar-a-Lago Florida residence.

title: Fires intensify in Canada, could last 'all summer'
description: Nearly 17,800 square miles have burned since the beginning of the year, well above previous averages as the country warms quicker than the rest of the world amid climate change.

title: June spreads LGBTQ+ Pride and rainbows around the world
description: In the US, this year's Pride celebrations are taking place as legislators in many states seek to ban drag shows, restrict gender-affirming health care, and limit how teachers can talk about sexuality and gender in the classroom.

title: Man City wins first Champions League title after victory over Inter Milan 1-0
description: Rodri struck in the 68th minute to see the Premier League champions and FA Cup winners complete a treble of trophies this season.

title: The Unabomber dies in prison at 81
description: Theodore Kaczynski, the Harvard-educated mathematician who retreated to a dingy shack in the Montana wilderness and ran a 17-year bombing campaign that killed three people and injured 23 others, died Saturday.

title: The one-time Parisians returning to their hometowns: 'Like starting the second part of your life, where you can rest from the first'
description: What if a new beginning was synonymous with a return to the past? For many French people tired of the capital and looking for a better quality of life, going back to their hometowns brings the paradoxical thrill of the unknown.

title: Former TikTok executive accuses ByteDance of collaborating with Chinese authorities
description: According to the testimony of a former TikTok engineer before an American court, the platform has been sharing user data with the Chinese authorities using a 'backdoor' process, particularly employed to spy on Hong Kong protesters.

title: In MMA, Dagestan and Chechnya are breeding grounds for French fighters
description: On the night of June 10, Franco-Dagestani mixed martial arts fighter Nassourdine Imavov will face American Chris Curtis. Like Imavov, many men from the North Caucasus are now representing France.

title: Swiatek beats Muchova in French Open final, clinching third title
description: Poland's Iga Swiatek battled past Czechia's Karolina Muchova 6-2, 5-7, 6-4 to win her third French Open title on Saturday, June 10.

title: 24 Hours of Le Mans: The Iron Dames, the women behind the wheel in motorsports
description: At the start of the GTE Am event on Saturday, June 10, the team distinguishes itself with its all-female crew. It's a rarity in a sport that remains predominantly male.

title: Sudan: 24-hour ceasefire brings respite for Khartoum residents
description: Khartoum residents reported a welcome lull in fighting on Saturday, June 10, but few believed it would hold.

title: At bedside of Annecy knife attack victims, Macron speaks of 'the worst barbarity imaginable'
description: France's head of state visited the Haute-Savoie prefecture on Friday, June 9, 24 hours after the attack in which four children and two adults were seriously injured.

title: Neoperreo, the women's movement liberated from reggaeton
description: Long dominated by men's often macho rhetoric, the genre is now being reinvented by feminist artists steeped in internet culture, under the name neoperreo.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'For a European Parliamentary Union'
description: The economist argues for the creation of a European assembly of voluntary deputies from each country, with budgetary powers.

title: Ukraine: Intense fighting reported as last nuclear reactor shuts amid flooding
description: Ukraine's General Staff said Saturday, June 10 that "heavy battles" were ongoing, with 34 clashes over the previous day in the country's industrial east.

title: Annecy knife attack: Suspect charged with attempted murder while injured children remain hospitalized
description: A man suspected of stabbing four young children and two adults in the French town of Annecy on June 8 has been charged with attempted murder, a prosecutor said.

title: Josette Torrent, a child Resistance fighter, has reclaimed her voice
description: For 50 years, she kept silent. But the 90-something who joined the Resistance when she was just 12 is publishing her story in memory of her father and to raise awareness among young people.

title: Boris Johnson resigns from UK Parliament, decrying 'witch hunt'
description: The former prime minister announced on June 9 that he was resigning as a member of parliament, condemning the parliamentary committee's investigation into 'partygate.'

title: Ukraine has launched its counter-offensive
description: Kyiv's troops appear to have suffered heavy losses in their first attacks on at least six axes to the north, west and south, in order to test Russia's defenses.

title: France's left bickers over alliance strategy for European elections
description: Jean-Luc Mélenchon accused the other parties of wanting to break up the left-wing NUPES coalition. The four parties are struggling to maintain the unity they displayed during the pension reform.

title: Annecy knife attack: Three questions on asylum and the freedom of travel in Europe
description: The Syrian national who is the suspect in the knife attack in the French town of Annecy was granted asylum in Sweden in 2013 and applied for asylum in France in late 2022. His request was rejected four days before the stabbing.

title: Over two billion people could be exposed to extreme heat by 2100
description: If the Paris Agreement were to be respected, 400 million people would be at risk, five times less than if global warming reached 2.7°C by the end of the century, the course set by current policies.

title: Mali: UN peacekeeper killed, 8 seriously injured in attack
description: The attack took place in the northern Timbuktu region, an area where extremists continue to operate according to the United Nations.

title: Children lost for 40 days in Colombian Amazon found alive
description: Colombian president Gustavo Petro declared on Friday, June 9, that authorities found alive four children who survived a small plane crash in the rainforest more than a month ago.

title: Ukraine faces 'hugely worse' humanitarian situation after the dam rupture, according to UN aid chief
description: United Nations undersecretary-General Martin Griffiths declared on Friday, June 9, an "extraordinary" amount of Ukrainians are in need of drinking water, and warned about the ravages of flooding in one of the world's most important breadbaskets.
